timeline.message:
Use Caffeine in `RefresingAddressResolver`

* Change the life cycle of the DNS cache entry so that it does not expire.
* Use Caffeine for limiting the usage of DNS caches.

timeline.bodyText: How about adding setter to DnsResolverGroupBuilder as well?
timeline.author: minwoox
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -980,6 +985,20 @@ public static String fileServiceCacheSpec() { return CACHED_HEADERS; } + /** + * Returns the value of the {@code dnsCache} parameter. It would be used to create a Caffeine + * {@link Cache} instance using {@link CaffeineSpec} for caching file entries. + * + *

The default value of this flag is {@value DEFAULT_DNS_CACHE_SPEC}. Specify the + * {@code -Dcom.linecorp.armeria.dnsCache=} JVM option to override the default value. + * For example, {@code -Dcom.linecorp.armeria.dnsCache=maximumSize=4096}. + * Also, specify {@code -Dcom.linecorp.armeria.dnsCache=off} JVM option to disable it. + */ + @Nullable + public static String dnsCacheSpec() {

timeline.bodyText:
If we add the setter to DnsResolverGroupBuilder, we don't need this method.
We can accept the cache spec in the constructor so that we can make dnsCache as a final field.
timeline.author: minwoox

timeline.bodyText:
Could you move this private static method at the bottom of this class?
The reason that dnsRecordTypes is located at the top is that the method is used in the static initializer.
timeline.author: minwoox

timeline.bodyText: We can do this on the line 129.
timeline.author: minwoox

timeline.bodyText: Let's use the variable when it's needed. Or we can just inline this. 😄
timeline.author: minwoox
ikhoon

timeline.bodyText: Question: Do we need RefreshingAddressResolver when Cache is null?
timeline.author: ikhoon
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -65,7 +66,7 @@
     private volatile boolean resolverClosed;
 
     RefreshingAddressResolver(EventLoop eventLoop,
-                              ConcurrentMap<String, CompletableFuture<CacheEntry>> cache,
+                              @Nullable Cache<String, CompletableFuture<CacheEntry>> cache,

replies.bodyText:
I was concerned about delays in updating a DNS record if someone uses DNS failover.
But it seems too much to be considered here. So I modified it to work with Nonnull.
replies.author: masonshin

timeline.bodyText:
I think we could just do:
* Sets the cache spec for caching resolved addresses.
* {@link Flags#dnsCacheSpec()} is used by default.
timeline.author: minwoox
minwoox

timeline.bodyText: How about passing Flags#dnsCacheSpec() is cacheSpec is null?
timeline.author: minwoox
minwoox
minwoox

timeline.bodyText: What happens if the spec is off?
timeline.author: minwoox

replies.bodyText: I decided to keep the DNS cache as nonnull, so I've removed off from the spec.
replies.author: masonshin

timeline.bodyText: nit: Probably better to take non-null cacheSpec here. I think Flags.dnsCacheSpec() could be used before creating this class.
timeline.author: ikhoon

replies.bodyText: I've changed the cacheSpec as nonnull. 👍
replies.author: masonshin

timeline.bodyText: Not related to this PR, numAttemptsSoFar might be included in toString().

                               .add("cause", cause)
                               .add("hasCacheableCause", hasCacheableCause)

trustin

timeline.bodyText: Flags.dnsCacheSpec() is annotated with @Nullable. Is it intended?
timeline.author: ikhoon

replies.author: masonshin

replies.bodyText:
Would it better to make this NonNull when we define dnsCacheSpec?

+1 Because the error message of firstNonNull(...) would be ambiguous. Users can get a detailed error message early by making dnsCacheSpec() non-null.
https://github.com/google/guava/blob/7ef9f97cad23efee4cc18c63b5f3c90ca320f131/guava/src/com/google/common/base/MoreObjects.java#L64
"Both parameters are null"
replies.author: ikhoon
